reviews.review: Потрясающая игра.. даже сейчас=)

Учёный, опаздывающий на работу, не предполагал, что может случится в этот, казалось бы, обычный день.

Half-Life - это игра-феномен своего времени. Скриптовые анимации в реальном времени, скелетная анимация. Всё это впервые появилось именно здесь. Сюжет. Загадочный, интригующий. В тестовой камере исследовательского комплекса Чёрная Меза случается несчастье. Это должно было быть обычное испытание телепорта, но не тут-то было. Техника выходит из строя. На нашу планету телепортируются загадочные существа с планеты Зен и начинают воспринимать Землю как свою родную. Гордону (главному молчаливому герою) придётся разобраться в этом всём и позвать на помощь. Военные же, которых послали в комплекс, оказались не спасателями, а командой по зачитске свидетей. G-Man. Загадочная личность в образе человека явно с нечеловеческими способностями будет попадаться на протяжении всей игры, наблюдая за действиями Гордона Фримена. И как окажется, не с проста.
Переписанный движок Quake компания Valve его сделала под свои нужды и назвала Gold Source. Есть сетевой режим в виде "каждый сам за себя" с возможностью мгновенного респауна после смерти. Действия в мультиплеере развиваются довольно быстро. Играется по сей день так же бодро. 
В этом году Half-Life исполняется 20 лет! Поздравим же именницу и перепройдём в очередной раз этот шедевр.

This is how it all begin...

Play this game for the sheer nostalgia, because it's brilliant.
A true game of all time

Half-Life revolutionized how the industry looks at gaming. At the time of release in 1998 one of the major popular FPS games were Quake by id Software, a superb masterpiece, but what it was missing was what Valve had in mind. 

An immersive storyline experience.

Rather than doing cutscenes like all of the rest, they felt that the only way you could actually feel like you were part of the world was by placing you in it instead of a character controlled by you. They achieved this by making sure you would always see from the eyes of Gordon Freeman, a theoretical physicist at the age of 27, from the very beginning to the end. 

There is no narrator, no one telling you what's going on. It's just you experiencing and learning the plot. The level design is beautiful, you weren't playing just another level with another environment, what it did was it progressed the story by using the environment to make you think you were actually a part of the world, instead of using the arbitrary concept of levels like so many others. 
It convinced you that this isn't a game anymore, this is entertainment at its highest. 

When a monster would come at you in other games, it would usually scare you, but when you realized that all of the monsters AI was in fact just cardboard cutouts homing in on you, sometimes getting stuck on corners, it somehow took away from the experience. 
The Half-Life AI was the most advanced on the market, but there were certainly monsters designed to be stupid by choice, such as the headcrabs. 
But where it shines the most on is the HECU soldiers. They can flank, toss grenades, take cover and spit out information to other team mates. Another great AI is the houndeyes, they work in groups attacking together. Even the cockroaches were advanced, moving away from light, seeking food and running away from larger creatures. It's even possible to feed bullsquids. All of this to try and enhance the experience of you actually being there. 

Scripting made everything more immersive, it made sure that the plot mattered to you, and that the outcome of the ending was satisfying to keep you wanting more. It also made sure cutscenes wasn't necessary as it would take away from the experience. 
Every time you see a great scripted character in a game you have Half-Life and Half-Life alone to thank for it. 

The levels never became stale and boring since they kept changing them all the time. They mixed around with different mechanics and weapons to keep you interessted, weapons would be lying on logical places or dropped by someone rather than at a random place where the devoloper thought "This place is empty, lets place a weapon or powerup here". 

One example of excellent design is a place where you find something reffered to as snarks, they are essentially small bugs that you could throw away and they would jump around attacking, even yourself if you weren't careful enough. You're not really sure where they could be useful, but valve just introduced you to them so that you now know how they work. Later on you come across this ventilation filled with these, you crawl forward a bit and realize soldiers are shooting the ventilation down, it collapses and creates a large gap in front of you. 
Your only instinct is to load the bastards with snarks. This is one of so many examples that the game just keeps letting you try out new interessting things and it becomes a fun ride all the way through. 

Other games would either have a handfisted tutorial, which to me is like looking at the answers to a puzzle, why even bother doing the puzzle in the first place... or the mechanics would for the most part be the same, making the game boring after a while. 
It's the solutions to new problems that gives you satisfaction and enjoyment to a discovery. Which is something most games, even today, seems to have lost. Because, what else is there really to make a game enjoyable?

It's not just the weapons that mix it up, but also the enemies, you never fight the same enemies all the way through, it's constantly variating, not to mention all of the enemies are unique. 
Vortigaunts needs to charge before firing which means you can take cover in between, bullsquids charge when close and spit on long range, houndeyes are lethal in groups and need to charge to fire a damaging blast radius around them and headcrabs and zombies need to be timed with the crowbar to avoid taking damage. However, later on you recieve weapons so that killing them becomes much easier. 

Enemies actually react properly when you shoot them, sometimes they'll moan when they are hurt and grunts will run away from your grenades instead of just standing there. You can't just strafe left and right to dodge incoming nades like you can dodge linear hitscan fire, this creates a different experience than most other games at the time. 





Because that Half-Life is running on GoldSrc, a modified Quake engine, it recieved an infamous exploit, bunnyhoping. While it technically has nothing to do with the intended game it feels worth mentioning as it has created one of the most entertaining games to run and watch. It has a very high skill ceiling so there's no doubt Single Segments will always be improved.

This is one of the best games I've ever played. While later on sections can get a bit repetitive, this complaint becomes irrelevant once you make it through said sections and encounter something new, such as a new weapon or enemy. This is at least a 13 hour experience for new players and a 8 hour experience for returning players. 
If you ever get bored of it you can also instal mods which are extremely easy to handle.

This only way this could get better is with... maybe a sequel of some kind? Hmmm...

I was at first skeptical of Half Life due to the whole Whedonesque fanbase it has that treats this game as if it was its own religion, but that doubt of quality was quickly squashed. Half Life 2 has nothing on this game. Hell, nothing Valve has released since this has anything on this game.

This game reminds me of Firefly in the way that only thing bad about it is that the cult of fanboys surrounding it is keeping well-meaning consumers from casually becoming interested in it.

Великолепно!!!
10\10.
Timeless classic.

An alright game that has aged...alright, I guess. It's not a traditional FPS; there's rarely prolonged firefights with a massive amount of enemies on-screen. The game is much more meticulous, and you're spending more time figuring out how to move from A to B rather than dodging bullets. Much like Portal (a spin off that has gained a life of its own) the game concentrates more on thinking than shooting. The narrative has very smooth pacing as well, but otherwise it's aged, and it's honestly a bit boring at times. Portal just does it so much better. Perhaps its the drab environments that deter the game? I'd recommend it only if you're planning to play the entire series-for completions sake. On the plus side, the multiplayer is still active. Of course, I'm judging a decades old game by todays more evolved standards, so keep that in mind.
This game beautifully combines puzzler and shooter aspects to create an outstanding work of old-fasioned art.

The game that spawned so many more, a genre defining classic that still holds up to today's fps storylines. Completed reletively fast, in a mere nine hours, it is still gripping every step of the way. While the graphics have obviously aged since its hayday, it was not so unpleasent to look at that it made the gameplay unenjoyable. 
Not even mentioning the infinite spinoffs and mod's that this game brought to life by merely existing. (Counterstrike being one of the first and most known)

I'd recommend anyone who plays any fps game, or any game at all, to play through what is an iconic piece of history for this genre.

tl;dr -- It's awesome, play it.
The DON of FPS

This game certainly deserves it acclaim. It's a sound shooter, with a select few issues but nothing a gamer can't deal with. The assortment of weapons are all useful, and the beastiary is quite impressive as well.

Very original story, very interesting, and it keeps you pushing throughout the entire game, even when you're like 'ANOTHER partition of enemies I have to mow through, seriously!?'

If you enjoy platforming, a good story, a challenging final boss, and all around blowing the hell out of baddies with enough firepower to take over a third world country... you will enjoy this game.

P.S. Gluon Gun <3

EDIT: Also, it actually works. Unlike Half-Life: Source. Even if it gets a little picky in multi-monitor play.

If I was asked to choose which game defines the First Person Shooter genre, I would instantly choose Half-Life 1. 
How old it is doesn't matter because it is such a satisfying and thrilling experience that time itself cannot tarnish its reputation.

If you haven't considered playing the first Half-Life game in the HL series you should. It makes for hours of fun and exiting gaming. If you can't handle the old graphics you can buy the more updated game Half-Life: Source.

Nagyon jó sztorival megáldott FPS. A grafika mára némileg már idejétmúlt, ám cserébe kárpótol az elképesztő hangulat. Az átvezető videók hiányának köszönhetően teljesen belekerülünk a történetbe. A mesterséges intelligencia tud meglepetéseket okozni, nem agyatlan zombi módjára tör előre...a zombik kivételével ;)
A nehézségi fokozat pont megfelelő, egy-egy adott helyen történő sokadik elhalálózás után sem éreztem azt, hogy hagyom a fenébe, ez inkább ösztönzőleg hatott rám. Negatívumként talán az utolsó pár pályát tudnám felhozni, ott azért akadtak már bosszantó részek, bár ezek elsősorban a pályadesignnak voltak köszönhetőek, nem pedig az ellenfeleknek.
Man, oh man. What a game! if this game was a book, it would be the Half-life of books. i'm telling you.
Прародитель современных шутеров. В это должны играть самые трушные геймеры!
Modern FPS'lerin öncüsü...

Coming back to this over a decade and a half later; Half Life is like the first act of the origin story of an infamous villain. 

Witness the birth of the now much maligned "scripted, linear, FPS." Wonder at Valve's story of no story technique. Remark at how it shows signs of being intersting towards the end and question why it wasn't more like this in the first two acts.

It's alright fun and there are a few interesting weapons to mess around with. Pretty much required playing for anyone who cares to see the beginning of the beginning of the end of story driven FPS.
This game is a must-play, the roots of Half-life and Valve. Extremely fun and intense gameplay and storyline for it's time and it's still a tremendous amount of fun playing it today,
A classic. Simply awesome. GET IT!

If ever there was a game that upholds my beleife that the graphics don't make the game then Half-Life and its expansions would be es number 1. One of the best story lines to ever be seen in a shooter Half-Life managed to turn a mute, mostly faceless, practically characterless individual Gordan Freeman into one of the most easily recognized heros in modern gaming society. If you ever want to play something fast paced, rich with story, and more epic than a boot to the head then I vote Half-Life every tmie.

This is the game that started one of the best FPS franchises out there today.  The gameplay and aspects of this game where years ahead of its time.  I no longer enjoy regeneating health, I would much rather duct tape a health pack to my face and go back to killing interdemensional aliens bent on the enslavement of earth.  The lack of cutscenes is amazing.  The immersion in these games and the others Valve has created sucks you in and keeps you on the edge of your keyboard.   Valve has created an innovative new style to games that is shown throughout videogaming.  This is a must play for any Valve fan or FPS fan.  I can't wait for the next Half life game and whatever game Valve can come up with.

One of the best games ever made.
